result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Comply with all other bonds. 
Not to commit any more criminal offenses. 
Go to the public defender's office today (5/16/2022) to see if they will represent her.

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley J U Tejeda in court. 

Defendant verifies her address. 
Court questions the defendant if she received a copy of the complaint.
Defendant indicates she never got anything in the mail. 
Court provides a copy of the complaint to the defendant and gives the defendant a moment to review that. 
Defendant has now had a chance to review. 
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
/s/ SK 01/19/22 (e-mail to DA Warrants in re:  warrant/minutes available as of 01/19/22 sp)

09:33 AM Defendant Riley J U Tejeda not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls case.

Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Defendant does not appear.

State requests warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders warrant, $250 cash alternative.
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 9:00 am in Br 2
